projects.name: Echojam Radio
projects.description: A streaming-ready homepage concept for an underground internet radio station. Built with playful animations, a mood-based show calendar, and embedded audio player support for indie DJs.
contributions: Designed the layout and visual branding to reflect lo-fi, nighttime aesthetics
Integrated Howler.js to create a seamless audio player experience
Built a schedule carousel component using custom Tailwind transitions
Added light/dark theme toggle synced to system preferences
Embedded accessibility-first keyboard controls for navigating media and playlists

projects.name: Potion Planner
projects.description: A whimsical form-based app for organizing potion ingredients, magical properties, and brewing instructions—complete with real-time filtering and customizable potion categories.
contributions: Created a fully responsive UI with sortable cards and animated form feedback
Used Framer Motion to create spellbook-style transitions between views
Built form validation and category tagging system for potion types
Wrote accessible labels and helper text for screen reader support
Optimized layout for tablet and mobile brewing labs

projects.name: Nimbus Notes
projects.description: A cloud-themed note-taking interface that syncs thought fragments with a minimalist UI. Features markdown support, tag filters, and pastel visual theming for cozy productivity.
contributions: Designed a soft-focus UI using Tailwind and CSS blur effects
Integrated Markdown-it to support formatted note previews
Built a custom tag-based filtering system with localStorage persistence
Implemented a subtle autosave system with local feedback indicators
Enhanced accessibility with skip links and keyboard navigation

aboutMe.paragraph: ith roots in storytelling and creative design, Ember builds experiences that prioritize clarity, joy, and accessibility.
fter experimenting with digital art and UX, Ember ventured into the world of frontend development, where imagination meets logic.

ost recently, Ember contributed to a small team rewriting legacy interfaces and building tools to help volunteers streamline data entry. Their work emphasized clean components and friendly user flows.
utside of collaborative projects, Ember has crafted demo sites for fictional brands, explored dynamic UI animation, and refined layouts that adapt across devices and moods.
n every project, Ember blends structure with play—writing maintainable code, asking good questions, and chasing that ✨ feeling when an interface just feels right.
